Posts.Content: Jun 19, 2009 02:16AM - edited Jun 19, 2009 02:17AM by TCGGal It is the steroids that are keeping her awake. the nurses told me to not even waste an Ambien on night 1, but I did sleep on and off anyway. I am sleeping well now-but was REALLY CRANKED on day 3, my last day of oral steroids. I took a relaxing shower & an Ambien and slept the night away. I am on day 5 now, feeling better-less Neulasta bone pain today. It was gnawing, but not unbearable.Have a greats SE free day all!

I had no problem at a party yesterday and working today with a bare head.

Posts.Content: Jun 16, 2009 06:26PM TCGGal wrote: I wanted to say-I was at chemo for 4-5 hours. It was my first one. There was so much activity & Info, I never even picked up a book. Between the nurse explaining everything-the social worker, my hubby & my bff-there was no time. Plus I had the IV in almost the crook of my elbow, so no elbow bending everytime I did a bell would go off. I mostly to ok pics on my phone & texted them to my firends, and just sat & meditated . I will still take my stuff for next times, I am sure there will not be as much info this time.  Oh, my nurse said 7-10 days after 1st tc treatment...anyone else lose that quick? Love & Hugs my friends-oh & I had a great second day...  Laurie
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2009 01:22AM - edited Jun 18, 2009 01:23AM by TCGGal dbatt-so sorry about the partner issues-why do they have to crop up when we need them less? My dh got into a blowout the other day, we never ever fight-never...the pressure was getting too much, my illness preceeded by a long mastectomy recovery. I own my own small business and it is slow this time of year, topped by the increase in payroll due to my lack of time there...and he thinks I am getting bored with it-needless to say, guess where my butt is when I feel good? Worked 2 hours day 2 & 4 hours day 3. Planned to take today off cuz nurses said I would crash 2day...so far, not yet, up at 3am doing laundry. Plan to sleep later, maybe go to work if I am up to it. Have a great SE day-best wishes in your personal dilema. I will be thinking of you-all! Laurie
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2009 01:35AM - edited Jun 18, 2009 01:35AM by TCGGal pdaw- I just called my local cancer society, they said come on in! So I did. I also contacted franceluxe.com for a free head wrap , got some cute ones from oncology, as well as turbans, then yesterday, I tie dyed bandanas-I own an arts & crafts studio-I even made a red-white & blue for July 4th. I will probably wear my wig to a few social funtions, but my great MIL is making me some really pretty head scarves that will match my dressy outfits, should it be too hot or uncomfortable.I am ready for the hair SE....now watch, it wont fall ! then I can donate all these wonderful items-HIGH HOPES, I know!

Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2009 01:03PM TCGGal wrote: hi eveyone- Day 3 treatment 2 still feel good. Worked from 6:15am until 1:30 pm at my business today-grocery shopped, now home to type a message to my BC Sista's. If anything like last time tomorrow, Fri & Sat will suck, but I am not thinking about it & keeping a positive, positive attitued, although I will be staying home tomorrow. Anna-my bone pain started day 4 in the middle of the night...Friday & Sta terrible until I took an Aleve. I was avoiding Aleve cuz the nurses frowned when I said I would take it, but they said just don't over do it and take to much-thins blood & stomach pains...so I won't. Take care all. Laurie
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 14, 2009 07:46AM TCGGal wrote: Hi everyone, I have been sitting here for a couple days, reading these posts. My heart goes out to you all...I start tomorrow-june 15th. I am nervous, and really wish I had not read all this-I refuse to go in with preconceived side effects- I have to be positive...You ladies are all so positive, I hope I have not offended anyone, I certainly don't mean to. I just feel, for me, if I focus on my work ( I own my own business) and do what I can mentally to minimize the SE I will do better, pretend I don't know anything and take each day as it comes. Is that silly of me? I mean, its great that I know how to try to prevent these se's, but I have to go in positive...did you all have this mindset? How did it work for you? Am I just living in a fantasy world? I am soooooo mixed up in my head right now...

Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jul 5, 2009 07:43AM - edited Jul 5, 2009 07:44AM by TCGGal I totally forgot about the vision! I had double vision the first few days and that was weird-certainly more so on day 1. I will mention it to the chemo nurses tomorrow when I go for treatment #2. I am down in the dumps today. I am not looking forward to doing this a second time, let alone 3rd & 4th! Some of you say the second time is easier, but not for me so far. I know that keeping a positive attitude helps, so I am working on that today as well as tanking (drinking lotsa water). It actually feels like a year since my 1st treatment-it was the longest 21 days of my life...I wasn't that ill, but the bone pain-ugh....I dread it! Hope I can stay ahead of it & get relief from it this time. Have a great day my friends.

Posts.Title: thank you for giving me a choice seltzer wallycat

Posts.Content: TCGGal wrote: Hi there! Alot of you know my story: DCIS lt breast, bm. Frozen showed no cancer in nodes, path showed cancer cluster in 1st node-but no micro invasion found in breast tissue path. Onc is sending me to Roswell Park Cancer Institute in Buffalo, NY. She said "we have never seen this before."  So, long story short-she ordered tests. Today I had CT of chest, abdomen & pelvis & a bone scan. I know the scan showed something because the tech took additional shots of L2-L5. I turned to look at the screen and could see my lower spine all lit up. I am so nervous and of course, tomorrow is Friday, so I will have to wait all weekend and then some for results...I guess I am just looking for encouragement from my sistas. Laurie Dx 2/15/2009, DCIS, 1cm, Stage II, Grade 2, 1/2 nodes, ER+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in July 2009 PauldingMom jacee

Posts.Content: Jun 25, 2009 08:38PM - edited Jun 25, 2009 08:39PM by TCGGal ok, I am only posting because u have questions...I am a June chemo. I started taxotere/cytoxan x 4 every 21 days. My next treatment in July 6th. I am on day 11 and have yet to lose any hair. I am feeling really really really good. I had neulasta shot on the day after my chemo. Day one-I certainly felt weird after...and tired, but the actual treatment isn't hard-so try not to be nervous. Day 2 & 3, I was tired, still worked a few hours, but was overwhelmed with all the drugs I had to take for nausea, steroids, etc-but didn't ever feel "bad" those 2 days. Days 4, 5 & 6, bone pain was pretty harsh...I took the claritin & aleve only on the actual day of my neulasta-I will take the next 2 days this next time- I learned that my pain could not be controlled by tylenol or the tylenol w/codeine I was prescribed-so I broke down & took an aleve Sat 3am-it worked to relieve my pain. Since then, I have been like the energizer bunny-no nausea meds, only the cipro from day 5-14 because I work with a lot of kids. I was warned not to overdo the aleve due to stomach problems & blood thinning-oh, I did have BAD heartburn days 2 & 3, relieved with Maalox. sorry to butt in on your thread-I just hope I have helped a little as I am still new here too and still have tons of questions myself. I also hope I continue to feel this good and you all feel as great as I do.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in July 2009 PauldingMom jacee

Posts.Content: Jul 31, 2009 06:11AM TCGGal wrote: I am so sorry you cannot sleep. I use Ambien and or Melatonin. I don't bother taking them on TX day as I am way to hepped up on steroids, but I do still sleep on & off on that night. Yesterday, day 4 after tx #3 was HELL for me. I was soooo eexhausted, but too jittery to sleep. Never have had that happen before after chemo-I think the Prilosec I took for heartburn made me jittery and the anti-nausea meds made me tired . It sucked, but I took my Ambien at 7:30pm & slept thru the night until 5:30 am....phew , I feel better. I hope everyone else has a great, happy SE free day!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in July 2009 PauldingMom jacee

Posts.Content: Jul 29, 2009 06:04AM - edited Jul 29, 2009 06:04AM by TCGGal welll Ladies, I am from th eJune bugs but have posted here before. I cannot remember names, but can remember topics-yes after my dbl mx, I can certainly feel cold drinking going down...it is almost startling! My third TC tx was on Monday last...day 3 today, jittery and shaky today, must be steroids and lack of good sleep. Heartburn sux- I take prilosec 20mg, but had to drink some maalox before bed too. hair was growing back, but is now falling out again. I did shave my head on day 14 of my 1st treatment, but alot of it was growing and I actually shaved it again, but now it is def going. They said it would when I saw them on Monday. Lotsa rambling, sorry, it is the shakies. Hope everyone has a great day! Laurie
